facts.description: Neptune is the eighth and most distant planet in our solar system. It is a dark, cold ice giant, known for supersonic winds and its deep blue color.

size.comparison: If Earth were the size of a nickel, Neptune would be about as big as a baseball.

orbital.eccentricity: Neptune's orbit brings it sometimes farther than Pluto from the Sun due to Pluto's eccentric orbit.

rotation.seasons: Neptune experiences seasons lasting over 40 years due to its long orbit and tilted axis.

temperature.description: Neptune's frigid temperatures are typical of outer solar system planets, and its distance from the Sun gives it dim sunlight.

environment.potential_for_life: Neptune's extreme temperatures, high pressures, and volatile materials make it unlikely to support life as we know it.

features: Deep atmosphere of hydrogen, helium, and methane
Merging into icy and watery layers above a rocky core
surface.appearance: Neptune's deep blue color comes from methane in the atmosphere, which absorbs red light and reflects blue.

moons.description: Neptune's largest moon, Triton, is unique with its retrograde orbit, suggesting it was likely captured by Neptune.

rings.description: Neptune has five known rings, with peculiar clumps of dust called arcs stabilized by the nearby moon, Galatea.

magnetosphere.description: Neptune's magnetic field is tilted 47 degrees from its rotational axis, causing extreme magnetic variations. Its field is 27 times more powerful than Earth's.

formation.description: Neptune formed around 4.5 billion years ago, likely closer to the Sun before migrating outward.

namesake.mythology: Named after Neptune, the Roman god of the sea.
